alert.note: Alert for Morris (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 04 at 10:22PM CDT until July 05 at 2:30AM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: The National Weather Service in Topeka has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Morris County in east central Kansas... * Until 230 AM CDT. * At 1021 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Council Grove, White City, Wilsey, Parkerville and Council Grove Lake. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
